1.text: And after this, I saw four angels standing at the four corners of the earth. They were holding the four winds of the earth so that no wind would blow on the earth, or on the sea, or on any tree.

2.text: I saw another angel ascend from the rising sun with the seal of the living God [in his hand]. He cried with a loud voice to the four angels to whom it was given to harm the earth and the sea,

3.text: saying, “Do not harm the earth, the sea, or the trees until we have sealed the bondservants of our God on their foreheads!”

4.text: I heard the number of those who were sealed: one hundred forty-four thousand, sealed out of every tribe of the children of Israel:

5.text: of the tribe of Judah twelve thousand were sealed,   of the tribe of Reuben twelve thousand,   of the tribe of Gad twelve thousand,

6.text: of the tribe of Asher twelve thousand,   of the tribe of Naphtali twelve thousand,   of the tribe of Manasseh twelve thousand,

7.text: of the tribe of Simeon twelve thousand,   of the tribe of Levi twelve thousand,   of the tribe of Issachar twelve thousand,

8.text: of the tribe of Zebulun twelve thousand,   of the tribe of Joseph twelve thousand,   of the tribe of Benjamin twelve thousand were sealed.

9.text: After these things I looked, and behold, there was a great multitude which no one could number, out of every nation and of all tribes, peoples, and languages, standing before the throne and before the Lamb, dressed in white robes and holding palm branches in their hands.

10.text: They cry with a loud voice, saying:  “Salvation [belongs] to our God who sits on the throne and to the Lamb!”

11.text: All the angels were standing around the throne, along with the presbyters and the four living creatures. They fell on their faces before his throne and expressed adoration to God,

12.text: saying:  “Amen! Blessing, glory, wisdom, thanksgiving, honor, power, and might, be to our God unto ages of ages! Amen.”

13.text: Then one of the presbyters spoke and asked me, “Who are these who are arrayed in the white robes, and where did they come from?”

14.text: I told him, “My lord, you know!” He said to me, “These are the ones who have come out of the great tribulation. They have washed their robes and made them white in the blood of the Lamb.

15.text: Therefore, they are before the throne of God and they offer divine service to him day and night in his sanctuary. He who sits on the throne will tabernacle with them.

16.text: They will never be hungry or thirsty anymore. Neither heat nor sun will ever scorch them,

17.text: for the Lamb who is in the midst of the throne is their shepherd and leads them to the springs of the waters of life, and God will wipe away every tear from their eyes.”
